description:
This course introduces the political, economic, and
security issues in the interstate relations of Southeast Asia
since the end of World War II. It studies regionalism and
regional cooperation and conflict in Southeast Asia with a
focus on ASEAN as the epicentre of Southeast Asian
regionalism. It examines how ASEAN member states
have coped with various challenges and sought to
manage regional order and stability.
title: ASEAN and Regionalism in Southeast Asia
